thread.title: LeGarrette Blount latest to skip trip to White House

title: LeGarrette Blount latest to skip trip to White House
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs LeGarrette Blount latest to skip trip to White House Andrew Joseph 4:41 p.m. ET Feb. 9, 2017 1 Shares 
(Photo: Getty Images) 
The list of New England Patriots players that won't be making the trip to the White House continues to grow, and running back LeGarrette Blount is the latest to speak out. 
Blount joined The Rich Eisen Show on Thursday and confirmed that we will skip out on the opportunity to visit the White House with his team. 
He said: 
"I will not â€¦ It's just some of the things - I just don't feel welcome into that house. I'm just gonna leave it at that." 
Tom Brady, Bill Belichick and owner Robert Kraft have a personal friendship with Donald Trump, but that has not been a deterring factor in other Patriots players taking a political stand . Martellus Bennett, Devin McCourty, and Chris Long have all said publicly that they won't celebrate the Patriots' Super Bowl title at the White House.
